Reviews.Title: “Good location, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: WarsawTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for five nights. The location is excellent, near Taksim square with busy nightlife and not far from the Old Town by metro/tram. The room was well-equipped with coffee making facilities, bathrobe and option to select a pillow of choice. Daily newspaper was provided and the internet (wi-fi) worked well. An iron/board might make a nice addition. The room air conditioning was set to too hot and we had no way of changing it, after opening a window it was a bit noisy but in the 7th floor it was OK. Breakfast is served in a lovely top floor restaurant with a terrace and great view and selection is excellent, with lovely Turkish cheese and a healthy options table as well. The spa was a bit disappointing - does not offer much intimacy when you use the sauna or steam bath and there was only one shower in operation. To use the swimming pool you need a cap, a big minus - they sell it at a high price.

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: vituzzo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Point hotel at the end of March for business for the first time and I have to say that I was expecting a better accommodation. Nothing to complain with the service, particularly on checking in and checking out. What really disappointed me was my room; maybe I have just been unlucky. I got a room on the first floor with just a small window that was pretty useless and I had to keep the lights on all the time. Furthermore the room was quite small, L shaped, and quite uncomfortable. The bathroom has seen better times and needed some maintenance. All was working, but looked old and a bit worn out. The amenities were quite poor compared to other, cheaper, hotels in Taksim. Finally I found the room very noisy and I had a very bad night due to the noise coming from the corridor. Overall I found the room quite below the standards I was expecting. I didn't have the opportunity to use the other hotels facilities, so I cannot comment. However I have stayed in better hotels in Taksim at lower rates.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: dannyvanheck
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 days in the hotel. Rooms are OK and well equied, but noisy environment, service at reception is not really customer friendly, always long waiting for elevators, fitness room is very poor, ... but the breakfast and food is good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goldi2011
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in point hotel in Istanbul during September 2011. The hotel location is very good in the heart of Taqsim area in Istanbul. Metro station is 2 minutes away form the hotel. I see it's a good hotel for tourists and budget travelers but not for business ones. Overall, the hotel furniture is poor, rooms are clean but not as I usually seek.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent and pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: DHafez
Reviews.Content: I am writing to you from point hotel, the hotel is by far the best 4* htl that I Have tried. I will start by the location, it is almost 10 min walk from Taksim square in that busy and beautiful area. You are surrounded by all the cafes, restaurants and shops. I am here on a business trip so unfortunately can't really get the best out of the location. Facing the htl there is small grocery shop which is v helpful. The hotel rooms are so modern and clean. With an LCD, nice bathroom and a wide single bed and a working desk.we have free Internet in the room and the conference room as well. The room I got doesnt really has a view but other rooms have! We were welcomed by a small box of nuts on the bed for a relaxing night. There is coffee and tea making facilities int eh roo . The food is so nice and really tasty. No need to tell how amazing the desert is. The staff r friendly and welcoming. For the coference room it is spacious and sound proof.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mohamed_Alnazar
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul in a business trip for 3 nights. I originally booked in another hotel near to Point hotel when I discovered that it was a simply a disaster. I checked out after an hour and walk to see the Point hotel. The staffs were supportive and helpful. Simply they helped me a lot in booking the rooms for me and my colleagues with good rate and supported me in arranging the meeting room as soon as they came to know about my situation. Rooms are well decorated, clean, roomy and classy. It's exactly what their in the Pictures. Excellent room services with great breakfast. Well located hotel, with great welcoming friendly staffs. Free wireless internet access and 24 hours business center. They offered me 2 bottles of water free of charge every day with free 2 pieces for laundry daily. It was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “good 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: jormaa
Reviews.Content: I was business trip in istanbul and stayed Point hotel Taxim. Nice 4 star hotel, great wiev top floor restaurant where they have great breakfast. Pool and two different sauna deparment was exellent. Good location too.Only small minus was arrival desk.I had late arrival and they did not gave me non smoking room. I find out this next morning but had so busy shedulle in my business and forget it.3 morning I was asking new room but no chance. Last evening I had fantastic dinner in Japanese rastaurant ,located 1 floor in hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RanaC18
Reviews.Content: Very well located hotel. It's very easy to get there. It's in the central Taksim area but at the same time not in the middle of the over crowded Istiklal street. The rooms are very comfortable with all the needed amenities, and 2 free bottles of water daily. The bellboy was very friendly and helpful. The only thing that I didn't like is the breakfast room, even though it overlooks a big part of Istanbul, but it needs refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonWizard
Reviews.Content: Good central business hotel near the convention centre and close to Taksim Square. Friendly and helpful service with a smile. Bottled water provided daily. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great all in one business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elvis936
Reviews.Content: Very good centrally located business hotel. Staff were attentive and provided a very good level of service. Plenty of shops and eateries within easy walking distance. Rooms were a little stuffy and the AC is only operated during summer months, the windows can be opened though.

Reviews.Title: “All around great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaDeee
Reviews.Content: While not suited to families I would certainly recommend this hotel to couples old and young, solo travellers, business travellers and friends as a calm, safe oasis from the wonderful craziness that is Istanbul. Great location, just 3 minutes walk from Taksim Square. You then have the choice of either walking downhill down the main shopping street (which pretty much takes you anywhere north of the Galata Bridge that you want to go...Or take a short funicular ride down the hill (located in Taksim Square) and jump onto the great tram system to hit all the tourist spots on the other side of the bridge. Also 2 minutes walk from the Havas airport shuttle bus stop which was very convenient. Feels very safe even walking home very late at night. There are a few restaurants close by but beware the tourist traps â€“ venture a little further instead (refer to Lonely Planet â€“ we tried a few great places). Also check the kebab places where SÄ±raselviler Caddesi meets Taksim Square â€“ great for quick bite. As for the hotel itself, our room was immaculately clean (even the bathroom) and the staff were fantastic. We stayed in a Deluxe (which is the standard) room. The room was a great size, enough for a huge (we think it was super king) bed, a single seater arm chair with foot rest and desk with chair along the window and STILL room to spare. TV, minibar and tea/coffee making facilities all provided. We had a small gift waiting for us on arrival along with two bottles of water and two packets of nuts which we received again each day we stayed. Free wi-fi was also provided and was quick enough and password provided in room. Breakfast was also great â€“ much variety and the almost uninterrupted views over Istanbul were great. Hotel also has a lovely bar in the lobby for beer, wine and complementary snacks. Also worth checking out the pool, sauna and steam room downstairs. Quiet, calm and lovely. You will need to pay a nominal fee (I think it was 6 EURO) for a swimming cap if you donâ€™t have one of your own with you but itâ€™s a proper reusable cap so you keep it to use again if you wish to swim. Didnâ€™t have time to try the treatments but the rooms looked lovely and also immaculately clean. Highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A+ hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yahe
Reviews.Content: Hotel is perfects , staff are very friendly , in one word amazing hotel, I suggest this hotel for all travels , solo traveler , young couple , family .... Chicks are around...

Reviews.Title: “Warning for rouge shoe polishers outside”
Reviews.Author: style_uncompromised
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in connection to a congress at the Istanbul International Congress Centre (ICC) which is some 10 min walk away along a heavily trafficked main road. At the time of writing this review I have stayed at two medium class business hotels in Taksim, Istanbul, and this I would argue is the slightly better one of them. Having said that, the hotel is anynomous and as such quite boring. Personal like a train station. Also beware that there are rouge 'shoepolishers' on way to the walk to the ICC. They look like tramps and try attract the attention of tourists by seemingly accidentally dropping one of their shoe polish tools on the street. Whatever you do - do NOT attempt to help. If you do that they will want to polish your shoes ;as a thankful gesture' only to then aggressively demand ridiculous amounts of money for the 'service'. This leaves a bitter aftertaste - you feel robbed - and the fact that these tramps (another gorilla tramp; same trick) were still outside the hotel 8 months after my first visit to Taksim just shows that the Istanbul hotels do not care too much about their tourists. If I ever have to go back to the ICC I will insist to stay at the Hilton next door to ICC. Whatever it costs it will be worth the difference. Sorry to write this but that awful experience is all I will ever remember from Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AyhanF
Reviews.Content: Very good location hotel. Room is small but nonetheless very clean and comfortable. No problems with Internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: AnitaBrazil
Reviews.Content: Pros - Good location, just few meters from Taksim, with cafes and restaurants nearby - Free internet, with ver good speed - Very good breakfast, with nice views - Friendly staff with good level of English - Good value for money - in the region there are other good brand hotels as Hilton and Intercontinnental, but they were much more expensive - Clean Cons - My room on the 2nd floor, facing a small street, was a bit noisy - Bed was a bit too soft for my taste - Dark bathroom The hotel has other services I didnt have time to use as Spa, Turkish Bath, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great for business users”
Reviews.Author: IainRH
Reviews.Content: Having recently been travelling to Istanbul on business, myself and my colleague had previously stayed at the Sheraton in Maslak near our customers office but we were keen to find somewhere central and convenient to stay. The Point Hotel is very conveniently located just a few hundred yards from Taksim Square and almost directly across teh street from the Geziparki exit from Taksim Metro station. Getting back to Maslak is a 15 minute Metro ride at a cost of just 3TL (67p!). The hotel staff are excellent and provide a warm, friendly and efficient welcome. As a business user, you are also greeted with a package that includes free wifi, 2 bottles of water in your room each day, free pressing of a shirt and trousers each day, access to the swimming pool and spa area and free newspaper etc. The only slight downside is that the fitness room is currently being refurbished so is downgraded to a very small room with one bike, one treadmill and an inclined bench. The hotel also boasts a bar, a cafe area and two restaurants - one of which serves well prepared Japanese fare. Prices are easily below what you would expect to pay in London with a fairly good bottle of wine costing just over Â£20. With the Taksim area just outside the door however, there is plenty of choice. My 7th room floor was well appointed with flat screen TV, two good sized beds (pretty much two doubles), a desk area and a good sized bathroom - where the only real disappointment was found - the shower was not much better than a dribble although teh water was nicely hot. Overall, a great hotel for business users that want access to the more vibrant or older parts of the city to explore at a reasonable price - â‚¬145 a night room only.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not all rooms are at same level”
Reviews.Author: JohnDoe049
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for almost a week in November 2011. I was staying at the 4th floor and my room had terrible isolation. It was almost impossible to warm it up although the air conditioner was working fully, and the noises outside felt like just next to you. Yet, I have found out that my friends in other floors did not experience such problems so be cautious when picking your room or at least bear in mind to change it if you are not satisfied. Other than that, the hotel is excellent, its breakfast place has a nice view of the Bosphorus and moderate menu, its bar is open until 2 am and service is great. All the personnel is friendly and warm, and I also must add the small treats in the room is thoughtful and pleasing. The swimming pool and sauna is also very clean and excellent. The venue of the hotel is also very near to Taksim square, close to city's heart. Overall, if you pick a nice room, you will be very pleased with the level of service and quality that you will experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: LarisaVM
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights only, but I was pleased very much. The location is perfect, within walking distance from Taksim square and shopping area. My room was small but very clean and cozy. All necessary items were present, including tea/coffee equipment and CD player with relaxing CD placed next to it. Very nice view from the window. The breakfast was lovely, the restaurant where breakfast was served was located on the upper level allowing to enjoy the very nice panorama. The staff was extremely friendly and nice. I did not have a chance to visit gym, hopefully it would not dissapoint me. I would recommend this hotel to other visitors, just make sure in advance that your room is exactly as you want - mine was small, but that was just the type of the room, they have a plenty of bigger ones. Have a good stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place! good value for money”
Reviews.Author: miguelstanley
Reviews.Content: The hotel is more of a business hotel than a comfort hotel. It is very well located and staff are very helpful. Clean rooms. Very few tv stations in English. No elevator to spa. I was on the 8th floor and on Friday night needed sleep and there was a wedding going on on floor above me till almost 1 am. Very loud. I was however offered another room, but just the hastle! Breakfast was food with great view over the city. No soy milk! All on all not a memorable place but not bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful junior suite”
Reviews.Author: bokaterina
Reviews.Content: We booked a simple double room and we were upgraded to a big (40m2) suite. This room is really big, it has the right size for a private quarter. There is no view from the room, but you can enjoy your self inside.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: SylviesMama
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a superb location and has spent a great deal of time training the staff. It's a real pleasure to check into a well run hotel that places it's highest concern with guest satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “If I visit Turkey again, I won't choose any other hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ahmed A
Reviews.Content: I came to know the hotel through booking.com. The staff were very friendly, esp. the people at the reception desk. I was surprised to receive a call from Seda, a female employee, just shortly after I got into my room. She said that she was ready to offer any help and info about where to go in Istanbul. I thought that was smart. The hotel is located at a walking distance from Taksim square, the famous Istiklal Rd. and the Metro station. I especially enjoyed the view from the balcony. Everything was so wonderful, esp. the restaurant located at the top storey with a view to the sea. I DO recommend the hotel for any one who enjoys traveling to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very central, but noisy inside and outside”
Reviews.Author: andreunz
Reviews.Content: LOCATION The hotel is in a very central location. The levels of traffic outside it, unfortunately is unbelievable and so the number of people at every hour of the day and night. ROOM The room I was provided was nothing really special: overseeing some old, ugly construction at less than 3 meters distance. You could see the bricklayers in front of you, with the cement in their hands, during any normal working day. The door is badly isolated, therefore you could hear everyone walking, talking, whispering. On a Saturday morning at 8,00 we were woken up by some worker removing the plaster from the corridor. Goodbye weekend sleep â€“ it was extremely noisy. STAFF Receptionists are normally quite friendly. There is lots of staff everywhere, but sometimes they can be unprofessional in terms of dealing with specific requests. 5 stars with merit, instead, to the restaurant staff. Careful waiters and maitre, very attentive to the customer needs and polite. Very well! Overall level of English is less than low very often, thus it becomes difficult to communicate In summary, "ok" hotel with superb location (rooftop terrace view is great), but oftem performs as a 3 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “in the heart of the city!?”
Reviews.Author: OkanSoysal
Reviews.Content: Very crowded location. Be carefull ! Being at the heart of the city may not be always nice. Noisy location. Not for relaxation. Hotel rooms needs some renovation. Air conditioning working great. All hotel staff are very friendly although some are very unprofessional. Check your room before you accept it. There are few rooms looking to the neighbours where you can not open the window unless you want to chat or drink a tea with some strangers :) Nice view from the restaurant looking to the old Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, nice view”
Reviews.Author: C S
Reviews.Content: Nicely located at the center of Istanbul. 3 minutes walk from the airport bus station (Havas), 5 minutes from metro station, 5 minutes from Taxim plaza. Staff is friendly and efficient. View from top floor restaurant is excellent. Only warning is that if you stay at 8th floor, stay away from near by the restaurant when there is a live music being played. It is notably bothering until late. Overall, I had a pretty nice stay there. I will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern 4 * Hotel in European side of istanbul. We will be back.”
Reviews.Author: jumsie06
Reviews.Content: Price was very reasonable. Hotel is very near Taksim Square a tourist spot. Checking in was fast though the bellboy broke a wheel off my suitcase between the cab and my room, and didnt apologise. I was disappointed that there was no complimentary breakfast, but there is FAROS restaurant right next door to the hotel where a turkish buffet and a la carte breakfast are served. Shopping area nearby eg Istiklau caddesse. Staff who speak english are very friendly and helpful. The twin beds are rather narrow, so a large person wil not find it comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: BarcelonaLiz
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty neat place with ammazing breakfast.The staff is polite and efficient andmore importantly the hotel is close to shopping and subway.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: nazzal_11
Reviews.Content: my advice for all don't take this hotel for honeymoon its very good for tourism trip. there is many better hotel in Taksim the room it was so small and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “well located and great views from the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: mottyandfluff
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to many places on foot. Environment feels safe and secure. No hassle from any of the staff who were all helpful and obliging.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for conference centre. Good middle grade hotel”
Reviews.Author: nickcambridge
Reviews.Content: Large no nonsense hotel amongst many other similar hotels in the area near Taksim Square. Good sized double room. Excellent breakfast on 9th floor not a destination hotel

Reviews.Title: “No better place for an invigorating offsite business event”
Reviews.Author: jyotinmehta
Reviews.Content: It was my firt trip to Turkey and we had an offsite event for our organisation. I had honestly not heard about The Point Hotel and was therefore skeptical. We stayed there from April 28 to May 1, 2011. From the moment of our arrival, I was more than convinced that the Hotel was very appropriate for handling a large group like ours - we were about 100. The staff were friendly and efficient - all of them understood and most of them could communicate in English. The rooms were very comfortable - most appropriately designed for busines travellers. The bathroom was clean and innovatively done up. We used the buffet at coffee shop for lunch and breakfast - nice spread and good quality food. The conference room in the basement is huge and well equipped. The conference rooms on 14th floor were also good. Location is great with some shopping close by. Ended up with a memorable and comfortable stay

Reviews.Title: “Poor value for the money”
Reviews.Author: fightingtreeantiques
Reviews.Content: Pluses: Point Hotel is in a lovely area, full of wonderful cafes (check out Poros Bar and Cafe Italiano) and little shops selling Istanbul souvenirs at better prices than the Grand Bazaar. Minuses: Unfortunately, the drawbacks at the Point Hotel will make you want to spend more and more time out of it. The double rooms are quite small. There are no dresser drawers so expect to leave all of your clothing in your luggage during your stay. The beds are hard as rocks and every single traffic sound heading towards Taksim Square can be heard starting very early in the morning. The service is abominable - ranging from snooty and snippy to non-existent. Be careful about making reservations online - the front desk staff will claim that they don't know how to make changes because "it's handled by another company online." Perhaps worst of all was the air circulation in the room - the fans emitted a weak puff and then gave up, resulting in a sweltering hotel room each and every morning. If I had not been booked into this hotel by my company, I would have moved immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy”
Reviews.Author: FilipMigom
Reviews.Content: Go to the 9th floor and enjoy the great scenery you get during your breakfast. Short distance to Taksim and down to the water and DolmabahcÌ§e SarayÄ± The room is small and the bed was rather hard to sleep on.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a few minor irritations.”
Reviews.Author: Lufta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The point while working in Istanbul. The location was good, right in Taksim and from the breakfast room there are lovely views accross Istanbul. The room was cheaper than many other hotels in the area and we also booked a conference room at a reasonable rate. Most of the staff are very polite and friendly and go out of their way to help you. There are a few things which could be better though. My room had an awful view over other buildings although there's not much they can do about this. Also the room was quite dark and although modern, could have been more airy. The shower was good but the bath was tiny. The breakfast wasn't very good either. It seems like lots of left overs from the night before and a selection of Turkish pastries. I feel they should offer more for their international guests. All in all the Point Hotel is clean, modern and well-placed although it's by no means perfect.

Reviews.Title: “OK, But Sure There Are Better, Service Lacking”
Reviews.Author: SoxFans07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Point before leaving on a Cruise. The hotel was OK, but nothing spectacular for the pricing. The room was clean, but we were given a room with 2 twin beds and were unable to change to a room for a full, because they were booked...not off to a romantic start to the trip. (The room was also quite noisy with street noise and smelled of smoke.) The service in bar was lacking to say the least, it took 10-15 minutes to get served, on the second night we gave up and went to bed. The breakfast was very good for a hotel buffet, only complaint was that the staff seemed overwhelmed and coffee took sometime to be served. If you got it yourself from the counter...you took the risk of being caught and scolded.

Reviews.Title: “very noisy hotel, bad air conditioning, uncomfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: gertBrussels
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Point Hotel for business reasons. The hotel is very badly isolated, from external noise, but also from rooms next to each other. Sleep quality was therefore very poor, as the hotel is located in a very busy environment in town. On top of that the airconditioning didn't work in the rooms, as they were switched of during this time of the year. The result is that it was sometimes very hot in the room. Beds are small and very hard, not comfortable at all. Breakfast is local, and not the healthiest choice. Lunch was very good. All in all, not to be recommended if you need a very good quality sleep during nights. Bathrooms is also extremely small, but the shower is comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel at good location”
Reviews.Author: Eberg
Reviews.Content: Excellent service of the staf. The room was good and clean. Only breakfast could have been a bit more international, however the view on the bridge made everything ok. Due to changes in my programm a sudden late check was absolutely no problem. Next time when I need to be on this side of Istanbul I will try to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Houda86
Reviews.Content: It has a great location, the room and the bathroom were clean. The service and the sttaf are good. The breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: GoneTravelin
Reviews.Content: We arrived mid-morning to this hotel expecting to have them hold our luggage until check-in time. No problem, we were given our room immediately. The desk staff was very helpful and responsive to our many questions. The room was modern and nicely furnished. There was free wifi in the room. The breakfast buffet was excellent. The hotel is several blocks from Taksim Square - a very convenient location. We walked to many places. The A/C also worked very well.

Reviews.Title: “bill fraudsters”
Reviews.Author: londonadamas
Reviews.Content: I was staying for two nights, ate in and used a bar. Then leaving May 25 about 5 am in a rush and there was a fraud attempt (EUR 35) from the reception stuff, until I pushed for the paper bill to be issued.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a super location with...”
Reviews.Author: SoumiCPH
Reviews.Content: Great value for a super location with very warm and friendly staff. Nice breakfast setup on the top floor with views of the bosphorous. The gym is a disappointment - an afterthought in the smallest windowless room in the basement. I would still go back. The Japanese restaurant in the hotel is good value with a nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: luismac
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the Point Hotel. Very clean, friendly 4 star hotel. Breakfast was very good and served on the ninth floor with a breathtaking view of Istanbul. very very good Japanese restaurant on the ground floor. Area is ok but a bit noisy. Taksim is full of high class hotels so it could be that there are better hotels around. We certainly could not complain: service was courteous and efficient. We travelled as an all in package so we cannot comment on the value. very good modern design and spotlessly clean

Reviews.Title: “There are much better hotels in Taksim”
Reviews.Author: Nikki_Elchin
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights in this hotel in Feb 2010. When I checked in I was given a corner room which was so tiny that I coud hardly move. I asked to change the room and the second one was slightly bigger, but still not the average single room size you can stay in Istanbul. By the way I visited Istanbul 9 times before and I can say my stay in Point Hotel was one of my worst. First of all, I was awaken because of vacuum cleaning in the corridor at 7.30am! It did happend two days in a row! If hotel management reads this, please do urge your staff not to clean rooms at least till 9am! They disturb people in the next rooms. The breakfast was great and lobby was beautiful. Free internet in the business center! Location is super but I am afraid I can't call it 4-star hotel. Istanbul is a great city and you can definetely find a better price vs quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definetely not a hotel for those who come to rest to Istanbul!!”
Reviews.Author: firemode
Reviews.Content: More or less Good service.. Food not of good quality...The first day I had a broke window and then I asked to change for smokers room, but I didn't happen to smoke in the room. However the room smelled so badly with tobacco smoke, that I couldnt bare it..had to sleep with open windows to not have the smell...Its ventilation doesnt work well. Too much noise in the corridor... Internet totally sucked..Would recommend it with many reservations though..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: awalton2006
Reviews.Content: Luxurious, calming, beautiful. Perfect location to all places in the city. Loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Totally satisfied”
Reviews.Author: giouxou
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with a friend during xmas 2009 for 3 nights and we were totally satisfied. The staff is very kind and willing to help you, though some of them don't speak english fluently (we had a few communication problems!!!!). The room was very clean with a magnificent view (detail to be mentioned: they don't have toilet brushes!!!). During breakfast we had a great variety of food options and a view of the Golden Horn harbour. The hotel is situated close to taxim square (around 3 minutes walking).

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: JoanThessaloniki
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel with modern design, good location. Good enough breakfast which was served on the last floor of the hotel (nice view). Very polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “5 Days in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BMZ08
Reviews.Content: The Good: the location of the hotel is excellent, it is in Taksim and near Istanbul's heart "Istiklal street", and it is near the metro station where you can go to Levent or go to Kabtash to pick the tram to sultanahmet. the staff and their manager were very nice, they gave me the room although that i arrived around 7 AM. the hotel had a free wi-fi access. the hotel offers a newspaper and two pieces of chocolate every day, and two water bottles at arrival. the breakfast is in the 9th floor with a nice view. The Bad: i was given a room on the first floor that is very noisy ( traffic noise), and the window was broken. when i asked for another room, i was offered a new room but much smaller. although i asked for a non-smoking room, i was given a room in a smoking floor. in addition, rooms are not sound proof, the sound of people talking in the hallway can be very noisy. the breakfast is not very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “IF you need to be in Taksim, an excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: CintiKidCincinnati
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed Point Hotel for a week. Quiet, friendly, spacious. In Istanbul one should stay in Sultanahmet region, but our meeting was in Taksim - so we used funicular (underground) and tram to get to historic sites. But Taksim also has nice sites. Breakfast excellent. Price reasonable except one day much higher during music festival. Crossing streeting at Point Hotel can be hazardous! Many nice eateries in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely recommend this hotel to others”
Reviews.Author: angel1130
Reviews.Content: It was my third time in Istanbul and my second stay in this hotel. Centrally located, nicely decorated (modern), clean rooms, rich breakfast with great view from the restaurant, friendly staff. Value for money compared to other hotels in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A great touch of class!”
Reviews.Author: Pierre-T
Reviews.Content: In the middle of Taksim, Istanbul's most busy square, Point hotel is an oasis where tourists and businessmen will enjoy genuine Turkish hospitality combined with high-level comfort. Intelligently decorated with wonderful photographs of Istanbul in the 50s-60s, by Ara GÃ¼ler the hotel offers vast, comfortable and cosy rooms. Small details like a relaxing CD or sleepers make you feel a welcomed guest. Do not wonder if you receive a phone call 10 minutes after your arrival - it is the guest service that will ask you if you are satisfied - here people care about you. The breakfast service on the top floor, with a view on the Bosphorus, invites you to discover some hidden gems of the Turkish cuisine, both salty and sweet. A smiling staff will make your first hour of the day as pleasant as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Smells terrible and the breakfast is a disaster”
Reviews.Author: crovonrosso
Reviews.Content: Monday 27 october 2008 We have stayed here for 3 nights. First thing when we entered the room was this awful artificial strong smell. Phoney luxury! No real coffee. No real cereal breakfast! No working keyboard. It stinks when you open a window. Awfull loud street level noise comes into the room. When someone above you flushes the toilet it sounds as if its happening in your own room. You hear everything spoken in the corridors. First we have slept with a closed window but then we had a sore throath and red eyes in the morning from the bad air.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Marco_Tarik
Reviews.Content: I have been several time in the point hotel during my frequent business trip in Istanbul. The rooms are enough clean and wide. The staff is very gentle and ableto solve any problem. If you like the Japanese cuisine, I had lot of dinner in the Udonya resturant loctaed at the ground floor, food have excellent taste. The breakfast is served in the roof and has excellent choice of cold/hot buffet. The Taksim area is nice to have shopping and find good resturants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, really !!”
Reviews.Author: kkktookmybabyaway
Reviews.Content: Just one word : Excellent ! I will definitely stay there during my next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty to Look At, Lousy to Stay At”
Reviews.Author: Prof_Fwy
Reviews.Content: Well it's nice to look at, if you like that fashion-forward, Architectural Digest look. And it sounds good -- on paper. The only thing I can't complain about is the location. Other than that? 1.Service ranges from indifferent to bored, with a side-stop at uncaring. 2.Ordered orange juice in the restaurant, got Tang. 3. Tried to change a 50 YTL note (about $42 USD -- not a huge amount) and was turned down 3 times. "We don't have change." Desk, bar, restaurant -- all had the same story. Had to walk to the Hyatt to do something as simple as change a bill. 4. Rooms are tidy but poorly insulated from sound. Stay on the first floor (2nd floor in US) and you might as well be living on the street. Enjoy the sound of your neighbor's phone ringing at 2 a.m. -- your neighbor from 5 rooms down. Enjoy the sound of everyone walking past your room. Stay in one of the many rooms located directly across from, or next to, the elevators, so you can hear those ringing all night long. 5. Food and drink are ridiculously overpriced -- 10 YTL for an Efes beer (the local brew), or about $8.50. Mind you, you can get the same bottle of beer at the convenience store across the street for 2 YTL. 6. The staff are programmed to refer you to taxicabs. There's a Metro station 3 blocks up. It's remarkably easy to use. A cab ride that costs 15 YTL costs slightly more than 1 YTL by Metro. 7. The "fitness center" is a swimming pool. And the pool and the spa are open from 7:30 am to 5 pm, prime travel/tourism/ business times. 8. Enjoy the free internet. But bear in mind what the "real" costs are.

Reviews.Title: “Great Turkish Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Sailor1977
Reviews.Content: Staying at the point hotel Istanbul last week was a great experience. The modern hotel is at an excellent location at Taxim Sqare in a special secured hotel area. Apart from the really great facilities I do want to mention the outstanding service. Beeing a frequent business traveller I am quite demanding regarding this, but the point hotel staff gives much more than expected. No matter whether it was the airport transfer, Istanbul tips or simply the fact that whenever we entered the hotel lobby, somebody immediately took care of us. When we asked for a restaurant recommendation they did not only answer this, also the reservation, transfer and even an excellent table was rganized at once. Arriving at the restaurant we had the impression that the staff there had only been waiting for us - simply EXCELLENT. Also a "must do" is the breakfast buffet overlooking the city on the 9th floor. We will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: sugaraki
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Point hotel in March. I was there for a weekend with a friend just for leisure. The hotel is centrally located in Taxim square. The service is above average, the staff really friendly. The room was modern but small. The best is the breakfast room on the top floor with a variety of food.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed, very dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: JTFBrussels
Reviews.Content: The location is just ok, not great. If you are going for tourism, you'll need to take a taxi (one way about 7 euros) to most of the sites. The biggest issue that we experienced was the heat in the rooms. During the winter months, they have no AC in the hotel of any kind. These means that if the sun comes out, your room will start approaching 25 degrees cel and there is nothing that can be done about it. This includes the breakfast room, etc. We were switched to two different rooms, and both had the same issue. No fan was offered or anything. You must open the windows and that means serious noise at all hours of the night- Mosque calls, sirens, construction, you name it. You will not be able to sleep. I asked for a reduction in price as a result, and had to speak with two different managers. Thirty minutes later, 15% was offered. This place is considered a luxury hotel, I consider airconditioning to be a standard option, as well as a good night's sleep. Neither of which I received. The breakfast is stale, the warm is cold, the cold warm. The drinks all have ice floating in them, so if you are worried about the water you have no real options other than to drink what they offer. If you go to the spa, it is ok if you are a man, but if you are a woman, be prepared to see a lot of middle aged, overweight Turkish men staring at you as if they have never seen a woman in a swimming suit. Towels, robes, slippers, etc, all had to be asked for, the staff sighing when you asked for these items and handing them to you as if it was not their job. Service is not friendly, must be asked for, and is generally not very good. It was the first trip to Istanbul, and not a good impression at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ghighiLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Point Hotel at the end of August for a few days of sightseeing. The staff were very helpful and friendly, always ready to offer advice on where to go, what to see and how to get there. The facilities were really good too, the swimming pool and spa were very clean and well maintained (pity the pool is indoors). The free internet facility is handy too. And it was good value for money. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad, not so good...”
Reviews.Author: Cancale
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Point Hotel for a 5 days stay in Istanbul. It was quite hard to book that hotel for us but we really wanted that one as we are quite fond of modern hotels nip/ tuck style. The hotel location is perfect for visiting the city, just a few tram stops away from the main sights. The Interior of the hotel is not as sleek as it appears on the website, and our room was soooo small for what we paid!! Moreover the cleaning was really badly done, and worst, we were given a dirty (I mean DIRTY) bath robe... Otherwise the rest of the staff is very friendly, the hotel as an inside pool and a sauna very nice. So to resume this hotel is ok but it does not have the style it pretends, I am not recommending it even if I had not a terrible stay, just a medium-low one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and very modern”
Reviews.Author: lbmore
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Point Hotel on business for about one week and really enjoyed it. It is ultra modern. Excellent free internet connections in rooms, quiet and nice location close to Taksim Square and the convention center. The breakfast buffet on the top floor was wonderful. And a KILLER view. Worth stopping in for a bite even if you don't stay at the hotel. It's a little far from the big tourist stops - Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, etc. But only about 15 minutes by Taxi and close to the subway. And the Taksim Square area certainly has its own charms. My only complaint was the smoking - elevators, lobbies, everywhere. But, that's unavoidable in Istanbul. Istanbul is a wonderful place to visit and this hotel is a great place. Definitely would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DINKYtraveller30
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3 nights at the Point hotel and having read mixed reviews we were unsure what to expect, however, we were really impressed. The rooms were modern, clean and well cared for and looked just like the pictures on the website. There were nice touches e.g. free internet usage, slippers, dressing gowns, chocolates on your pillow. Breakfast was great with a good variety and great views. We also had excellent service throughout our stay and found all the staff very attentive. The hotel is a good walk from the old town, but very near to the main shopping/eating area which was very lively and we thought was great.

Reviews.Title: “very good choice”
Reviews.Author: diakos
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Point a four months ago on a business trip to Istanbul and was very pleased with my choice. The location is perfect, next to Taxim square, where one can find literaly everything within walking distance Interior design and decoration is modern and the enviroment both at he lobby and the rooms is very pleasent. Business facilities are very good also, there is wireless internet access throughout the hotel (not free) The staff is very helpfull and speak good english.

HotelInfo.Name: Point Hotel Taksim
HotelInfo.Address: Topcu Caddesi No 2 Taksim, Istanbul 34437, Turkey
